data.title: Friday night dinner
data.text:
Cool-looking place. Was very crowded, which is fine, but the seating was a bit awkward. Was very hard to hear while trying to talk over dinner. Wait staff was very friendly, food got to us within a reasonable time and was warm and good. I would probably have enjoyed it more on a week night when it's less busy. 

They have a good variety of drinks.

data.title: A fun and interesting place.
data.text: All types of American and Scottish foods and drink. We enjoyed the attire of the servers and were pleasantly surprised when a bag pipe player showed up and played for the restaurant. Very good eats!

data.title: Good atmosphere, great food, 4.5 stars
data.text:
My family and I had dinner here during our first visit to Cincinnati.  We came in on a Sunday evening at around 7pm, and there were a few folks at the bar and seated at the tables.  With all the apparently very good places to eat at in Cincinnati, this seemed like a good sign.  Also, it was literally right next door to the hotel we stayed at (21c Museum Hotel).  It was one of the tastier meals that I've had in recent memory, and pretty much everyone enjoyed what they ordered.

Service:  4 stars
-There was a party going on in the back room so I think that might have tied up the servers a little, as a few seemed to be pulling double duty attending to tables and the party.  
-Our server was initially busy taking care of other folks so one of the other servers came by quickly to take our drink order.
-The entire staff seemed upbeat and generally to be at work.  We did not see any slouching, dragging feet or frowning faces.  Everyone that greeted us seemed cheer or at least very polite.   
-Service was attentive and not pushy.  From the time we sat down to the time we walked out, dinner lasted about an hour and a half and our server checked in on us 3 times, not counting taking our food order.  That was just right for me.    
Food:  4 stars
-I would say pass on the Belhaven Beer Cheese Dip.  Its good, but not great.  The dip was fairly salty, and a bit runny for dipping the supplied chips and pretzel nuggets in.  
-Fish and Chips:  my father ordered this, based on a table-top advert claiming it rated as the best in the country.  It was outstanding, certainly above any fish and chips we've had at other places in the US.  The server claimed this was due to using haddock instead of cod, but the breading and tartar sauce definitely helped.  Get the 3 piece order!
-Short Ribs:  my mother ordered this, also terrific.  The short ribs (boneless) were perfectly braised, very tender and not fall-apart soft.  The polenta wasn't great but at least offset the richness of the short ribs and sauce.  The pumpkin slice was a nice tough, but the roasted seeds were a bit crunchier than mom expected.
-Shepherd's Pie:  My wife ordered this, and this is the way Shepherd's Pie should taste.  Its all lamb, with the peas and carrots adding some color and sweetness.  The mashed potato topping was nice and dry without being overly seasoned or buttered, perfect for providing a nice background for the lamb.  Wished it was a little less salty.  
-Lamb Burger w/ BLT+E:  The lamb patty had rosemary and one other spice mixed in (forgot what it was), but like the Shepherd's Pie the lamb flavor was very pronounced.  If you're not a huge fan of lamb, do not order this (thinking it might be like the gyro-meat you get a some sub-standard Greek place, all seasoning and no lamb).  I ordered mine medium and it came out as such.  The bacon, lettuce and tomato on top was fresh and the runny fried egg was a nice tough although I would have preferred it more fried.  So good, but at $13 and change it was a pretty expensive burger.
-Duck Fat Fries:  flavor was OK but they were overly soggy, and very salty.  Probably could have stuck with the standard fries.
-Fried Brussel Sprouts:  Yes, order these.  Very fried, good but again on the salty side.
-Belhaven Scottish Ale:  definitely tasted the butterscotch and had a great creamy mouthfeel, but the toasted malt was not as pronounced as the description leads one to believe.  Decent beer.  
-Bell's Oatsmoble Ale (cask):  very aromatic beer, great nose and smooth finish.  Went great with my burger.
Value:  5 stars
-Dinner for the 4 of us was $95.01 without tip and we were all very full with no leftovers at the end.  Perfect!
-As mentioned, the burger I had was a little on the pricey side given its size but overall I felt the entrees were fairly priced.
Atmosphere: 4 stars
-A beautiful u-shaped bar dominates the first area as soon as you enter.  Small bar height tables line the left wall which is neat.
-We sat in a semi-enclosed dining area with a (non-lit) fireplace, it felt cozy and was probably much quieter than dining in the bar area.
-Lighting was dim but not overly so.  Enough that we could see our food and read menus, so it was comfortable.

Overall, we had a great dinner here and if there weren't so many other highly rated restaurants in the area, I'd love to come back again for lunch or dinner.  But our stay here is short so we want to try out other places.  I'd highly recommend Nicholson's to others.  Just make sure you drink a lot of water given how salty most of the dishes seem.

data.title: Great Pub
data.text:
This is a great place for a pint. They have a number of different beers from Scotland to Ireland, to American Craft beers. They also had a number of different layered beers, Scottish and Irish Whiskeys. 
  We didn't eat at Nicholson's but their Pub Fare did look extensive and everyone eating seemed quite pleased.  We really enjoyed ourselves,or drink and the atmosphere at Nicholson's Tavern.

data.title: Good pub
data.text:
This is a Very Nice pub in downtown.
Lot of beers ans whiskey from great britain and ireland. Good food is served At The bar. It is a Nice Place in The late afternoon Lot of People there and it Makes quite hard find out a seat!

data.title: good pub food
data.text: I had spied this pub earlier in the day while being a tourist and thought it would be a good place for dinner as had a variety of choices. Our waitress Ashley was great with a sense of humour and suggestions as we didn't know the local beers. We shared the calamari and the 3 piece fish and chips which was a good size ( contrary to some other reviews) washed down with beer and Guinness and just leaving a little room for the sticky toffee pudding which was good. Overall a decent place at reasonable prices.

data.title: Update of my previous review dated November 4, 2015
data.text: Fried pickles are no longer on the menu. The Sticky Toffee Pudding is still delicious. The portions of the fish in the 3 piece Fish & Chips, are much, much smaller. The small portion of the Wedge Salad is enough for two. The quality of the food is still fine, and delicious. Everything else mentioned in my previous review remain the same.

data.title: Great Place to Dine
data.text: Reservations are suggested on weekends, especially if you have more than 2 in your party. This place could be pricey, depending on what you order. The Shepard's Pie, lamb hamburger, pot roast, country fried chicken, and the fish and chips are good choices. It was a nice atmosphere, and classic rock music filled the airwaves but it wasn't too loud.

data.title: Good food, but inconsistent recipes
data.text:
I have been to Nicholson's twice now, and probably will not return.  Our first time, I was blown away by the decor, the food, the atmosphere and had nothing but great things to say.  The shepherd's pie was phenomenal.  During my second trip, I got the shepherd's pie again but it was unbearably peppery and spicy.  I brought this up to the waitress and she was argumentative, claiming that there was no way it was more spicy than before.  She also did not offer me a different dish (I would have paid for something else).  I ended up leaving the restaurant hungry and with a bad (and peppery) taste in my mouth.  

Overall, this place is great and the atmosphere is very unique.  Unfortunately their food (or at least their Shepherd's Pie) is inconsistent with no room for customer suggestions/complaints.  I suggest that others give it a try and experience this place for themselves!

data.title: good food just not that much
data.text: Ate here for lunch on a Sunday.  Good place, clean and laid back.  The food was really good.  I had the shepard's pie and I loved it.  The only negative is for the price I paid, I would have liked to have gotten more food.  The entrée I got was more of an appetizer than a main dish.

data.title: One of the best restaurants downtown
data.text: My boyfriend and I both work downtown and like to meet at Nicholson's for lunch. We've been a total of three times and each time I've ordered something different, and I have loved every single thing I've ordered. Their gouda mac and cheese with the pork on top is what dreams are made of. Awesome food, fairly priced, great atmosphere. This is quickly becoming one of my favorite restaurants of all time.

data.title: Saturday Night Rush Was Too Much
data.text: Got a last minute table here after a baseball game. Restaurant seemed understaffed, but this was a Saturday, not a Monday or Tuesday. Food was mediocre at best. Fish sandwich was okay, Pork Tenderloin was okay, but served room temperature due to sitting under the warming lights and not at the table. They were out of several beers (this is a pub right?) and may take a pass next time. Beware of the open table if all else is booked...

data.title: Wonderful Ambiance
data.text: Went to Nicholson`s Tavern & Pub last friday. Had a wonderful time. Superb ambiance and wonderful staffs.

data.title: Oktoberfest Visit
data.text: In town for Oktoberfest.  Walked up with friends for a meal.  Service was great for 6 and food was Ok.  Crab cakes for me. Would go back.

data.title: A good Guinness pour and good food
data.text: Always on the lookout for a good Guinness, and this place knows how to do it! Billed as a Scottish Pub, the atmosphere is set as soon as you walk in: all the servers are wearing kilts! A beautiful long wooden bar sits at centre stage, with booths and tables all around. Food is traditional pub fare: shepherd's pie, bangers and mash, fish 'n chips, etc. Everything I've had so far was tasty and delicious. Also a very good selection of whiskies, Scotches, and bourbons (even had a Red Breast 12, one of my favourite Irish whiskies!).

data.title: Nice Irish Pub
data.text: Stopped for drinks and appetizers. Reasonable prices and very friendly service. The seating by the sidewalk was great.

data.title: Decent food and a good beverage selection
data.text: We enjoyed a pre-concert meal on a Saturday evening.  Service was good and we were able to get in and out on our restricted timeline. I had a nice house salad to start--it was very good with plump dried cranberries and thin, fish apple slices.  My entree was the shrimp linguini--a modest portion that had excellent flavor and the shrimp, though small, we're not overlooked.  My husband had the fish and chips.  I thought the fish portion was thin but he said it was okay.  We splurged on desserts--cheesecake and a toffee pudding--both were excellent.

data.title: This place is awesome!
data.text: Great location, food, drinks, staff, and prices. This is a Scottish pub with a huge selection at the bar. The waitstaff are in kilt uniforms and are very attentive and friendly. My lamb burger was cooked exactly right and the fresh made chips delicious. The fish tacos were the special and my husband loved them. We had the toffee pudding for dessert. Creamy and not too sweet. Great value!

data.title: Cool place to grab a beer and a bite
data.text: Stopped in here on a Saturday night while in Cincy, its an interesting place....a Scottish/Irish/English pub. Nice selection of beers on tap and bottles. I didn't order food but guy sitting next to me had Shepherd's Pie - it looked good and he said it was good. Prices were reasonable, service good. A good option if you are staying downtown and want a quick bite or just want to hang out and have a few drinks.

data.title: Love the fish & chips
data.text: Enjoyed the fish & chips with fries & slaw very much! Husband thought the lamb burger was just okay. Daughter enjoyed the buffalo chicken and mac & cheese. Service was pretty good. Very nice atmosphere. Convenient location.
